definition: Using letters like x or y to represent unknown numbers
A math sentence with an equals sign: 2x + 3 = 7
A symbol (like x) that stands for a number
A number that divides another evenly: 2 and 3 are factors of 6
What you get when you multiply: multiples of 4 are 4
Least Common Multiple — smallest number multiples share
Highest Common Factor — largest number that divides all
Space inside a 2D shape: A = L × W for rectangle
Space inside a 3D shape: V = L × W × H
Comparison of two quantities: 2:3 means 2 parts to 3 parts
